contents.item: That wasn't any act of God. That was an act of pure human fuckery.
God is silent. Now if only man would shut up.
Garcia wondered why people with JESUS stickers on their bumper always drove twenty miles per hour under the speed limit. If God was my co-pilot, he thought, I'd be doing a hundred and twenty.
If God exists, I hope he has a good excuse.

There is something infantile in the presumption that somebody else has a responsibility to give your life meaning and point… The truly adult view, by contrast, is that our life is as meaningful, as full and as wonderful as we choose to make it.

The stone that was rolled before Christ's tomb might appropriately be called the philosopher's stone because its removal gave not only the pharisees but, now for 1800 years, the philosophers so much to think about.
Philosophers can debate the meaning of life, but you need a Lord who can declare the meaning of life.
contents.owner: Max Lucado, Traveling Light: Releasing the Burdens You Were Never Intended to Bear

contents.item: If we cannot comprehend God in his visible works, how then in his inconceivable thoughts, that call the works into being?
contents.owner: Edgar Allan Poe, The Imp of The Perverse

contents.item: MIGHT, something God only has.
Pretend you are foolish to the foolish, and be yourself when you are alone or with others like you, because if you take the foolish seriously as your friend, you might be a fool yourself.
God is a philosophical black hole – the point where reason breaks down.
The most boring and unproductive question one can ask of any religion is whether or not it is true.
contents.owner: Alain de Botton, Religion for Atheists: A Non-Believer's Guide to the Uses of Religion

contents.item: I need just be a bayonet, a bayonet named Diving Punishment. I wish I'd been born a storm. Or a menace. Or a single grenade. No heart, no tears, just as a terrible gale'd have been good. If [by doing this] I become that, then so be it.
How charming is divine Philosophy! Not harsh, and crabbed as dull fools suppose, But musical as is Apollo's lute, And a perpetual feast of nectar'd sweets, Where no crude surfet raigns.
Preach in hatred and you will only find love.
When God sprinkled stars in the heavens, he opened our eyes to the wonders of the universe.
I don't have to touch God to know that he's real.
What comes into our minds when we think about God is the most important thing about us.
I believe in the fundamental truth of all great religions of the world.
Man is a demon, man is a god. Both true.
